title: Arc Raiders Flickering Threat Quest Guide
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          Quests in Arc Raiders sure like...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                Quests in Arc Raiders sure like to send you repair missions--so much so that you're probably feeling like a full-blown electrician by now. Flickering Threat requires you to jump into the Dam Battlegrounds map and fix up a power generator, so don't think you're getting any time off today. And if you're feeling a little lost on how to complete this quest, we're here to help you out.While you don't need to extract to complete Flickering Threat, you will need 4 Wires to repair the generator during the quest, so make sure to add those to your inventory or loot them from the Power Generation Complex while you're exploring. Without these in your inventory, the quest can not be progressed.When you're ready to tackle Flickering Threat, follow the steps below.Where to find the Generator HallThe Generator Hall is located on the left side of the Power Generation Complex in the northern region of the Dam Battlegrounds map. It's a high-traffic location that is often filled with both ARC and raiders, so come prepared for a fight just in case.Generator HallOnce you reach the Generator Hall, you'll be prompted to repair a generator. Here's to hoping you remembered to bring 4 Wires!How to repair the generatorTo repair the generator, head to the location on the map above and look for long openings in the ground. Use these to drop inside the Generator Hall. You can also get to this room via nearby doors and hallways, but dropping in saves a lot of time.Repair the generator using 4 Wires.Once inside, stand between the two elevators and look at the end of the westernmost one to see a prompt to repair it using 4 Wires. Interact with this prompt to finish your repairs. However, you'll now need to flip a power switch.Leave the Generator Hall via the southernmost door at the end of the hall. Follow the stairs up and through two more doors, then turn immediately left and pass through an additional two doors. In this room will be a box in the corner that you can interact with to turn the power on and complete the quest.Interact with this box to turn the power on.In this same room is a staircase leading up and onto the surface right near the North Complex Elevator. You can use this extraction point to return to Speranza--though you should be careful while doing so, as raiders frequently camp this spot and may try to kill you on sight. So, take it slow, and stay in cover while waiting for the elevator, then extract to return safely to Speranza.For more, check out our full Arc Raiders quest list.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: Get HBO's Succession On Blu-Ray For A Great Price At Amazon
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
    
              
          
                                                                                                                                                               Succession: The Complete Series is on sale for $67.66 (was $95) on Blu-ray at Amazon and Walmart. The box set includes all four seasons of one of HBO's superb satirical drama in one 12-disc Blu-ray collection with a bevy of bonus content. Succession: The Complete Series is also available on DVD for $41.49. The hit HBO show ended its run in 2023 with a pile of Emmy awards, high ratings, and universal acclaim. Big fans of Succession should also consider picking up Succession: The Complete Scripts. All four seasons are available to read in 700-plus page paperbacks for under $20 each.                                 Succession: The Complete Series on Blu-ray                                                                $67.66 (was $95)                                                                                                                                                                                    Succession is the story of Logan Roy, head of one of the world's largest media conglomerates, who just announced his imminent retirement. Now his kids, and more than a few others, have to spend four seasons jockeying for position in hopes of becoming the new boss while also earning a little bit of love from daddy.The Blu-ray edition of Succession displays in 1080p resolution in the show's original aspect ratio and has DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1 surround sound.The series ran for 39 episodes across four seasons from 2018-2023. After you finish watching all 42 hours of the show, you can check out over 20 hours of special features, including interviews with the cast and crew, retrospectives on main characters, production behind-the-behinds videos, and discussions about many episodes by the core cast and crew. Note that many of these featurettes aired on HBO each week as Inside the Episode videos.Succession: The Complete Series is also available in a 12-disc DVD box set for $41.49.                                                       Succession: Seasons 1-4 - The Complete Scripts                                                                $17 (was $30) for Season 1                                                                                                                                                                                    Published by Faber & Faber and officially authorized by series creator Jesse Armstrong, the script books for each season are incredibly enjoyable and insightful reads. The first three seasons have 720-plus pages, while Season 4's scripts total 656 pages.Succession featured some of the best writing on TV during its run. Conversations within the Roy family often featured wildly creative lines of dialogue--especially when they hurled insults at each other.What's cool about The Complete Scripts is that you'll routinely come across content that never made it into the show, including entirely new scenes as well as extended and alternative scenes. The scripts also include all of the stage directions and background details.Succession: Season 1: The Complete Scripts is on sale for only $17 (was $30). The 768-page paperback includes an introduction by Armstrong, who served as the showrunner and lead writer for all four seasons.Succession: The Complete Scripts (Paperback)Season 1 Scripts (768 pages) -- $17 ($30)Season 2 Scripts (784 pages) -- $18.30 ($30)Season 3 Scripts (720 pages) -- $19.50 ($30)Season 4 Scripts (656 pages)-- $20.29 ($30)                      More HBO Series on Blu-ray & DVDSeveral of HBO's other critically acclaimed series are on sale right now, including two of the best dramas ever made: The Wire and The Sopranos. For a comedy, check out Curb Your Enthusiasm: The Complete Series, which just released on Blu-ray in October.Curb Your Enthusiasm: The Complete Series (Blu-ray) -- $117.57 ($130)Curb Your Enthusiasm: The Complete Series (DVD) -- $68.50The Sopranos: The Complete Series (Blu-ray) -- $66.33 ($100)The Sopranos: The Complete Series (DVD) -- $55 The Wire: The Complete Series (Blu-ray) -- $60 ($83)The Wire: The Complete Series (DVD) -- $28 ($35)Succession: The Complete Series (Blu-ray) -- $67.66 ($95)Succession: The Complete Series (DVD) -- $41.49 ($60)Veep: The Complete Series (Blu-ray) -- $59 ($75)Westworld: The Complete Series (Blu-ray) -- $72Westworld: The Complete Series (4K region-free) -- $90                                                                                                                                               And for deals on movies, make sure to browse Amazon's Criterion Collection holiday sale, where you can save 50% on 4K Blu-rays, Blu-rays, and DVDs.Save title: Arc Raiders Power Out Quest Guide
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          If you've received an Arc...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                If you've received an Arc Raiders quest called Power Out and aren't quite sure where you need to go to get it done, you've come to the right place. This may be one of the game's most basic quests, but as with many of its outings, the act of getting there and getting back out can be more challenging than anything. So, we'll share the exact location of the quest below so that you can take some of the guesswork out, allowing you to focus on making the magic happen.You won't need to extract to complete Power Out, but you may potentially be making quite a trek to reach the quest location. It's not a bad idea to toss on a combat-focused augment with a good gun and shield, as well as plenty of ammo and healing items to ensure you're prepared to take on anyone standing in your way.When you're ready to tackle Power Out, follow the steps below.How to complete the Power Out quest on SpaceportThe first step to completing Power Out is to head all the way south on Spaceport to find the Electrical Substation. Depending on where you spawn on the map, this could be quite a trek, so while the area itself is pretty tame, don't be shocked to run into trouble on the way there.Electrical Substation locationOnce you arrive, you'll be prompted to find signs of an engineer who has gone missing, which is very easy to find. Identify the electrical box below.Electrical boxWhile looking at the electrical box, turn left and spot the engineer's bag a few steps away. Interact with it, take the item within, then return to the electrical box. Interact with the electrical box to place the item inside. Turn on the power to complete the quest.With the quest complete, your next goal is to extract. Unfortunately, due to being so far south on the map, you're going to have to walk quite a way to get to an elevator. Your choices are the South Elevator to the northwest or the East Elevator to the northeast, so make sure you're reloaded and healed up, then set off. We'll be rooting for your survival.For more on Arc Raiders, check out our full quest list.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
